channel.title: Rumor about Moparscape - NOT A HATE MESSAGE
channel.description: about 8 months ago i went on the IRC chat And The Next day i got a message from my ISP saying that "MOPARSCAPE IRC" was Malicious and telling me to scan my computer for heavy malware. i use malware bytes PRO so there was no need to scan for me. but is this real? and has anyone elts discovered this?

item.title: Rumor about Moparscape - NOT A HATE MESSAGE
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:17, topic:393663”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=490832.msg3589730#msg3589730 date=1304495956]

I’d be more concerned about your ISP watching your traffic than mopar irc being “malware” if I was you

my ISP is clever and forces an advertisement on the first page I load when I connect to the internet, but they also watch and filter everything we lookup/say

Tunnel everything through ssh?
[/quote]
when accessing any network outside of china they instantly cut your speed down to a maximum of 75kbs so yes I do at times but I suffer slow speeds. I love China telecom![/quote]
hahaha that’s like my normal maximum.

Read full topic
item.source: Rumor about Moparscape - NOT A HATE MESSAGE

item.title: Rumor about Moparscape - NOT A HATE MESSAGE
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Why the hell is your ISP monitoring what you do on the internet? The only thing they should be allowed to do, imo, is to see if you are consuming massive amounts of bandwidth, because that would be a red flag that your probably illegally downloading files.

As for them knowing that you were using an IRC client, that is kind of suspicious and I would ask them why they were watching you.

Read full topic
item.source: Rumor about Moparscape - NOT A HATE MESSAGE

item.title: Rumor about Moparscape - NOT A HATE MESSAGE
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:12, topic:393663”]If they’re assuming IRC is malicious, then they’d probably assume 4chan.org is this awsome harbour of the fearsome beast anon who can DDoS their servers into submission[/quote]^lol.

Also irc is safe as long as you dont accept files like MITB said.

Read full topic

They’d do nothing, as it’s not illegal to view.[/quote]
If they’re assuming IRC is malicious, then they’d probably assume 4chan.org is this awsome harbour of the fearsome beast anon who can DDoS their servers into submission

item.title: Rumor about Moparscape - NOT A HATE MESSAGE
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Niall:

I’d be more concerned about your ISP watching your traffic than mopar irc being “malware” if I was you

That’s what I was thinking.

IRC is always safe no matter what unless you accept a file transfer from someone, which could of course be malicious. But then there is no reason to do so, so just don’t.

Read full topic
